page.title: 01LANDSCAPE & REVIEW OF BLOCK
page.content: The area is cut in half by the River Lynher,a tributary of the River Tamar. In the locality of Notter Bridge,which is the highest point where the tide reaches,the sides of the river valley are very steep. Most of the block,apart from the two residential areas of Landrake and Hatt are farmed. It is an area of rolling hills which has seen relatively little change over the centuries.Many of the farmsteads are small in area,family run dairy farms,with old buildings and linked to the road network by narrow lanes,but being close to the main A38 Trunk road this area is no longer isolated. This survey looks at certain people in the village,a farm,events,the churches,trade and the community in general in order that the user will understand what life is like.
